stories.text:
People want to change the world. They want to support, buy from and work for organizations that do too.

The Kambeo platform is at the intersection of Cause, Community and Commerce.

By bringing these 3 pillars together, Kambeo is connecting those who need help with those looking to help like no platform has before.
stories.title: Show HN: Kambeo – Changing how people change the world

stories.text:
Jun 17: Eliot's BRIEF NARRATIVE

Risked His Scalp in Prayer

John Eliot put his life at the mercy of the redmen[0] to get them to listen to his preachings. He wrote vividly about his settlements of Christian Indians. Now villages and Indians have disappeared. Only his story remains.

Read: Eliot's BRIEF NARRATIVE

Vol. 43, pp. 138-146 (Download Link Here: http://www.myharvardclassics.com/downloads/20120213_28/download)

Please comment below on your own thoughts and feeling towards the reading.

Note: I am not affiliated in any way with myharvardclassics.com. They just have free downloads of .pdfs of the volumes is all.

[0] Woah! Right? I'm keeping the slur in for now as that's what the original text says. I'm expecting a lively discussion on race with this reading, so please be aware of it and it's meanings to Native Americans: https://law.marquette.edu/facultyblog/2013/12/why-is-the-word-redskin-so-offensive/comment-page-1/
stories.title: Jun 17: Eliot's Brief Narrative: Classics Reading Club

stories.text:
I’ve been searching for an app to enhance my planning and reporting as a creative freelancer, and I feel like Neo at the start of the Matrix at this point. So much searching.

Currently I just plan my days with time blocks in my calendar (using iCloud for what it’s worth). When I need to invoice a client I then just have to go through the calendar weeks and note the blocks for that client manually. It’s a stupid system.

I’ve tried using some freelancer / small business apps like Harvest or Cushion, but I have found that they are a bit much for what I need to do.

I have tried apps like Trello and Notion more recently, and they make a lot more sense, except both have drawbacks.

What I think I need in an app is: - multiple views including list, kanban and timeline - a calendar view for scheduling / planning - calendar sync of some kind would be great, but not an absolute must - ability to tally up the time I have spent on a given project - ideally offline usable - strong preference for pay once. I’d feel much better about paying $100 (or whatever appropriate amount) for software once than $10 a month on a subscription. - not needed: any team oriented features. I have no team.

Hoping I can get some help on this as I’m driving myself insane.
stories.title: Ask HN: What’s a good Trello or Notion alt for freelance planning and reporting?
